title: Africa to Asia: One man, two continents, eleven countries
description:
https://d2arxad8u2l0g7.cloudfront.net/books/1472500691l/31701678.jpg

In his latest fast-paced travelogue, Jason Smart visits two of the worldâ€™s most vibrant and action-packed continents: Africa and Asia.

Beginning his journey in Djibouti, he visits the lowest point in Africa before heading off on a whirlwind tour that takes him to Mauritius, Madagascar, Namibia, South Africa, Tunisia, Iran, South Korea, Mongolia, China and the Maldives.

Along the way, he sees lemurs and chameleons, finds out about corruption in paradise, enjoys the hospitality of Iran and learns that abseiling kits are standard-issue room equipment in South Korean hotels. In China, he walks on the Great Wall, in Tunisia, he experiences a city under lockdown and, due to a booking error, ends up in one of Johannesburgâ€™s most notorious districts where he sees the Southern Hemisphereâ€™s tallest slum. His trip ends in the Indian Ocean, where he gets to see some of the hidden underbelly of crime and litter in the Maldives.

Africa to Asia: One man, two continents, eleven countries by Jason Smart
English | 2016 |226 pages | ePUB | 1.3 MB
